channel.title: HTML Assistant (Feature suggestions)
channel.description:
I am in the process of creating an HTML Editor. I want to know, if you were coding HTML, what are some features you would want in such a program? I have 3 main ones that I am working on as you read this, but I would like some of your idea's.
If you would like to know what my HTML Assistant already has, even thought it is really basic right now, check out the Project thread in the C# section of my website.
Current Idea's [ul][*]CoonHunter - FTP Support [*]CoonHunter - Syntax Highlighting [*]CoonHunter - Line counting (on the side of text area) [*][s]Pure2Ownage - 'Instant'-Script[/s] - Decided not to do [*][s]Davidi2 - Snippets[/s] - Finished/Still progressing[/ul]
Please, either discuss, or suggest. No spamming.
What im doing now: [ul][*]Nothing, I need idea's that can be basic features before I do the more advanced stuff.[/ul]
These sound the same, and in general are, but I will make them different, like 'Instant'-Script gives you a custom dialog, and you input the information needed. For snippets, It will basically be a 'lookup' for some sample codes.

item.title: HTML Assistant (Feature suggestions)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:337656”]Make a WYSIWYG editor because there is no point to have a program that can only edit raw html. You might aswell you notepad if it can.
imo, html doesn’t need to much syntax highlighting anyway; the tags,strings are the only significant parts of the markup.[/quote]

I think the syntax highlighting helps developers in a small way, so they can find peices of code faster. The reason I am making an HTML specific program is because i need to for pracice. If i can successfully complete this, then adding more languages to it wont be hard.
